headline.main: ROTHMANS, CANADIAN TOBACCO COMPANY, SWEETENS OFFER

lead_paragraph: Rothmans Inc., Canada's No. 2 tobacco company, sweetened its takeover bid for the Santa Fe Natural Tobacco Company to $353.7 million, adding more cash to the offer and topping one by R. J. Reynolds Tobacco Holdings Inc. The original Sept. 27 proposal by Rothmans consisted of $275 million in stock, cash and debt for Santa Fe, a closely held maker of organic cigarettes. R. J. Reynolds, the No. 2 tobacco company in the United States, offered $320 million in cash on Nov. 22. The bidding war underscores the lack of growth opportunities as the number of smokers in North America declines. In Canada, tobacco-advertising rules are among the world's most restrictive and make it difficult for Rothmans to expand at home. Rothmans brands include Benson & Hedges and Craven 'A.'
